There have been a number of cultural initiatives implemented by Tokyo's governor and metropolitan assembly over the years. Here are a few examples:

1. Tokyo National Museum: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government has supported the Tokyo National Museum, one of Japan's oldest and most prestigious museums. The museum houses an extensive collection of Japanese art and artifacts, including many national treasures and cultural assets.

2. Tokyo Metropolitan Symphony Orchestra: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government established the Tokyo Metropolitan Symphony Orchestra to promote classical music and support the city's vibrant arts community. The orchestra performs regularly at venues throughout the city.

3. Tokyo Pop Culture Center: In 2020, the Tokyo Metropolitan Government announced plans to establish a Tokyo Pop Culture Center, which will showcase the city's vibrant anime, manga, and video game culture to visitors from around the world.

4. Edo-Tokyo Museum: The Edo-Tokyo Museum showcases the history and culture of Tokyo (formerly known as Edo) from its founding to the present day. The museum is supported by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government and features interactive exhibits and displays.

5. Tokyo International Film Festival: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government organizes the annual Tokyo International Film Festival, which attracts filmmakers and cinema enthusiasts from around the world. The festival features screenings of international and Japanese films, as well as events, workshops, and awards ceremonies.

These are just a few examples of the many cultural initiatives that have been implemented by Tokyo's governor and metropolitan assembly over the years.
